title: Giants rookie QB Dart 'efficient, effective' in debut
content: Giants rookie QB Jaxson Dart went 12-of-19, passing for 154 yards and a touchdown, showing impressive poise in his debut in Saturday's preseason game.

title: Rivera tears Achilles during Old-Timers' game
content: Mariano Rivera tore an Achilles tendon while going after a flyball at the New York Yankees' Old-Timers' Day game on Saturday and needs surgery.

title: Wrexham boss slams 'game-changing' call in loss
content: Wrexham boss Phil Parkinson insisted Southampton defender Ronnie Edwards should have seen red for denying a goal-scoring opportunity and called it a "game-changing" moment in their 2-1 defeat at St Mary's.

title: Lions' Norris stable after injury ends game early
content: A preseason game between the Lions and Falcons was suspended in the fourth quarter after Detroit safety Morice Norris was taken off the field in an ambulance.

title: At Old-Timers' game, Clemens talks Piazza toss
content: Roger Clemens came back to Yankee Stadium on Saturday, and so did the questions about his bat-throwing incident with Mike Piazza in the World Series 25 years earlier.

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Dolidze vs. Hernandez
content: Din Thomas picks Dolidze vs. Hernandez and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's cards.

title: 'I want it to be my life': Why Patrick Mahomes is much more than a celebrity product endorser
content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: Do the Cubs have a championship-level roster? Here's what MLB insiders think
content: After a trade deadline that was more mild than wild, we asked around the sport to see if the Cubs have enough to win big.

title: How the Indiana Fever adjust to season-ending injuries to Colson, McDonald
content: With Caitlin Clark out, the backcourt was already depleted. How will losing two guards impact the Fever's playoff race?

title: Caitlin Clark and 13 more impact WNBA players for playoff (or future) success
content: The margin for error is shrinking as the playoffs approach. Who will be the difference-makers for their teams?

title: Does NFL success and fame translate to college football success? These schools are betting it does
content: With high expectations for this new wave of celebrity coaches that includes Eddie George, reputation can take these leaders only so far.

title: Sesko signs: How Man United won the race and how he'll fit in Amorim's plans
content: Benjamin Sesko has completed his blockbuster move to Man United: How he plays, how he'll fit in Ruben Amorim's plans

title: Can Wrexham's Hollywood fairy tale continue, or is rude awakening ahead?
content: Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac have their sights on the EPL -- but the closer they get, the more unrealistic it is.

title: üèà Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: üèÜ Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: üèÄ Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: üèà ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: üëä Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: 'I'm made for it': Austin Simmons gets his shot at Ole Miss
content: At 19, the two-sport star has already graduated from Ole Miss, but he's getting his first chance to start at QB.

title: 12 colleges stacked with NFL draft talent: Why scouts are watching Penn State, Clemson this season
content: Which schools have the best talent for next year's draft? We picked 12 must-watch rosters loaded with potential future first-rounders.

title: Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski draws rare Pok√©mon Charizard card after win over Mets
content: The Milwaukee Brewers' vibes were high when they pulled a rare Pok√©mon card after extending their win streak to seven.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle tell Isak he can't leave to join Liverpool
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak has been told he cannot leave the club for Liverpool this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: What happens to ‚Äòmissing names‚Äô on Bihar SIR list? | Explained
content: What is the next phase in the special intensive revision of electoral rolls? When will the final list be released?

title: Police official deployed in Ashok Gehlot‚Äôs security arrested in paper leak case
content: Mr. Yadav allegedly obtained the paper illegally through a source and provided it to his son Bharat Yadav.

title: Rajasthan BJP spokesperson expelled over controversial remarks
content: BJP expels Krishan Kumar Janu for six years after he questions the party‚Äôs stand on ex-J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik and former Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar

title: First freight train chugs into Kashmir Valley, raises hopes of fruit traders
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi described the feat as a ‚Äúgreat day for commerce and connectivity in J&K‚Äù. ‚ÄúIt will enhance both progress and prosperity,‚Äù he posted on X.

title: Bengalureans overcome with ‚Äònostalgia‚Äô as India Post discontinues Registered Post, one of its oldest services
content: Registered Post, one of the oldest services of India Post, has long been a reliable source of communication related to court, governance, submission of college applications, personal letters, etc. due to its addressee-specific delivery system

title: SEP Commission opposes foreign universities setting up campuses in Karnataka¬†
content: State Education Policy (SEP) Commission chairman Sukhadeo Thorat told The Hindu that the commission in its report submitted to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday, had opposed allowing foreign universities directly setting up their campuses in Karnataka.¬†

title: No name will be deleted without notice, says ECI on Bihar SIR
content: The poll body told the Supreme Court that it would adhere to the principles of natural justice by giving voters facing deletion a ‚Äúreasonable opportunity of being heard and furnishing relevant documents‚Äù

title: ECI again asks Rahul Gandhi to submit evidence of irregularity in Karnataka Assembly election under oath
content: The Congress leader has claimed 1,00,250 ‚Äòfake votes‚Äô were created in the Mahadevapura Assembly seat in Bengaluru to ensure a win for the BJP

title: In Gurez Valley, a lone man is archiving the Dard-Shin story
content: For the past three years, Basheer Ahmad Teroo has been collecting vestiges of his community‚Äôs culture ‚Äì items that he has begun storing and displaying at his home in Dawar town

title: Why Maoists are on the wane in the once-dreaded Red Corridor
content: Maoists prioritised military preparedness and ideological indoctrination over any tangible development in the regions they controlled, and the very communities which they claimed to be championing suffered

title: Kerala marks golden jubilee of State Scheduled Tribes Development department
content: A separate department was formed for the welfare of tribal communities in the State 50 years ago, the Chief Minister says

title: US Senator Urges India To Use Its 'Influence' To Help Trump End Ukraine War
content: US Senator Lindsey Graham has urged India to use its "influence" to help President Donald Trump end the Ukraine war, hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Muslim Countries Must Unite: Turkey Slams Israel's Gaza Move
content: Muslim nations must act in unison and rally international opposition against Israel's plan to take control of Gaza City, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said on Saturday after talks in Egypt.

title: Woman's Head, Chopped Up Body Found In Plastic Bags In Karnataka
content: The severed head and dismembered body of a woman were found stuffed in multiple plastic bags along the road at Kolala village in Koratagere.

title: Maharashtra Government To Probe 26 Lakh 'Suspect' Beneficiaries Of Ladki Bahin Yojana
content: The Maharashtra government has ordered a large-scale verification drive targeting over 26 lakh beneficiaries of the Mukhyamantri Ladki Bahin Yojana amid suspicions of widespread ineligibility and misuse

title: Maharashtra Man Murders Mother Over Farmland Dispute, Then Kills Self
content: A 45-year-old man allegedly murdered his 70-year-old mother over a dispute concerning agricultural land and later took his own life in Maharashtra's Latur district.

title: Delhi Metro Sets New Ridership Record At Over 81-Lakh On Rakhi Eve
content: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Saturday announced that it had achieved its highest-ever single-day ridership on August 8, 2025, with 81,87,674 passenger journeys recorded across all operational corridors.

title: Sold For Marriage Twice, Missing Bengal Girl Rescued From Rajasthan
content: A minor girl from West Bengal who was abducted and sold twice for illegal marriage was rescued by the CBI from Rajasthan along with the arrest of five accused.

title: Operation Sindoor Full Of Surprises: US Warfare Expert To NDTV
content: US warfare expert John Spencer said many surprises marked Operation Sindoor, ones which are not expected in the clash of two advanced militaries.

title: UP Auto Driver Strangles Woman To Death For Not Wanting To Marry Him
content: An auto driver and his associate were arrested Saturday in connection with the strangling of a woman, whose body was found near the Mant Branch Gang Canal in Raya area, police said.

title: Millennials, Gen Z Account For Two-Thirds Of Blue-Collar Job Applicants: Report
content: In the blue collar category, Millennials and Gen Z continued to remain among the country's highest job-seeking population, accounting for 65 per cent of all job applications in 2024 as well as 2025, a report said on Saturday.

title: "Happy We Tackled Ghost Of Balakot": Air Force Chief On Operation Sindoor Evidence
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh said the non-availability of images of the damage caused by the Balakot air strike became a "big issue", and people could not be convinced about what was achieved

title: RG Kar Protest: 5 Kolkata Cops Injured, 6 FIR's Registered To Probe Violence
content: At least five Kolkata Police personnel have sustained injuries during the RG Kar protests in the city. Senior police official told NDTV, three have been hospitalised.

title: "Support PM Modi-Led Government Against Trump's Pressure Tactics": Sharad Pawar
content: NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday called for supporting the Central government against the "pressure tactics" by US President Donald Trump amid tariff tensions in the national interest.

title: Video: BSF, Meghalaya Cops Pursue, Arrest Armed Bangladeshi Gang
content: Four Bangladeshi nationals who allegedly attacked an Indian villager at a border area in Meghalaya have been arrested by the Border Security Force (BSF).

title: Trump Tariff Effect: Instagram User Shows Sharp Spike In Walmart Pricing
content: An Instagram user, Mercedes Chandler, recently shared a video from a Walmart store in the United States asserting how US President Donald Trump's tariffs are directly causing a sharp spike in prices across clothes and other items.

title: Video: Elephant Attacks Car Near Toll Plaza On Dehradun-Haridwar Highway
content: A huge wild elephant caused chaos near a toll plaza on the Dehradun-Haridwar highway today after attacking vehicles waiting to pass through the crowded road.

title: 47 Terrorists Killed In Balochistan By Pakistan Forces
content: At least 47 terrorists have been killed by security forces in Balochistan province near the Afghanistan border in the last two days, Pakistan military's media wing said on Saturday.

title: "Op Sindoor Demonstrated India's Advanced Defence Capabilities": HAL Chief
content: Operation Sindoor demonstrated India's advanced defense capabilities, indigenous strength and synergy of Indian defense forces by bringing together legacy and modern system operations, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) chairman DK Sunil.

title: Astronauts Return To Earth With SpaceX After 5 Months At International Space Station
content: Four astronauts returned to Earth on Saturday after hustling to the International Space Station five months ago to relieve the stuck test pilots of Boeing's Starliner.

title: Passenger Arrested At Mumbai Airport For Smuggling 54 Exotic Animals
content: A passenger was apprehended at Mumbai airport allegedly with 54 exotic animals, an official said on Saturday.

title: Political parties say they have filed many claims and objections after Bihar draft roll, though ECI lists zero complaints
content: Opposition party BLAs say they have filed multiple complaints on plain paper, counter-signed by poll officials; ECI is allegedly pushing those deleted from draft rolls to instead fill Form 6, meant for new voters

title: Four years late, Bengaluru metro‚Äôs Yellow Line ready to roll
content: The project was initially scheduled for completion by December 2021 but was plagued by a series of setbacks, including delays in land acquisition, the COVID-19 pandemic, and hold-ups in rolling stock supply from the Chinese manufacturer CRRC Nanjing

title: Four Bangladeshi men held after armed robbery attempt in Meghalaya
content: The incident happened at a border village in the South West Khasi Hills district; Police, BSF launch search for five others from cross-border gang

title: Caste Hindus begin razing ‚Äòuntouchability wall‚Äô in Karur after revenue officials, police intervene
content: Members of the intermediate caste initially refused to tear down the wall claiming that the wall was meant to prevent anti-social activities by ‚Äòoutsiders‚Äô under the influence of alcohol. The Arunthathiyar community alleged the wall was raised to prevent access to areas where the caste Hindus lived

title: Systematic pattern of mischief in maintaining electoral rolls: Kamal Nath
content: The Congress leader underlined the demand for machine-readable electoral rolls to be given to parties by citing how he had raised issues regarding voter lists in Madhya Pradesh back in 2018

title: Chandrababu Naidu aims to see poverty-free A.P. by 2029
content: Minister Narayana announced that 11 government high schools in Nellore will be renovated by next academic year

title: Ramalinga Reddy slams BJP for taking credit for metro project, says Karnataka‚Äôs contribution much higher
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy on Saturday hit out at BJP leaders, including State president B.Y. Vijayendra and MP for Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya, for claiming that the Yellow Line ‚Äî set to be inaugurated on August 10¬†‚Äî¬†was solely a Central government initiative.

title: Questions from Supreme Court‚Äôs chastisement of a High Court judge
content: The recent chastisement raises two questions, whether the top court can act as an ‚Äòelder brother‚Äô to High Courts and if ‚Äòinstitutional concerns affecting rule of law‚Äô would give the top court authority to intervene in the exclusive ‚Äòmaster of roster‚Äô powers of the Chief Justice of a State High Court

title: Damaged road makes daily commute tortuous in Vellaikoil
content: Residents have sought a separate ration shop for Vellakoil, pointing out that they had to travel nearly 2 km to Perumal Pettai to collect their rations

title: South Korean delegation wants Gadag delared as ‚Äòpeace district‚Äô
content: Delegates from South Korea based global peace organisation Heavenly Culture, World Peace, Restoration of Light (HWPL)¬†visited Mahatma Gandhi Rural Development and Panchayat Raj University in Gadag on Saturday and had a dialogue with Minister for Law, Justice, Human Rights, Parliamentary Affairs, Legislative Affairs and Tourism H. K. Patil.

title: Chhattisgarh government to launch Gaudham Yojana for stray cattle protection
content: Scheme to focus on curbing illegal trafficking; will effectively replace the Baghel government‚Äôs Gauthan Yojana

title: Decision on revival of G.O. 3 soon, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: As per the G.O., which was quashed by the Apex court, only local tribal people are eligible for government jobs in the Scheduled Areas; NDA Government striving to improve infrastructure, raise living standards, and boost the incomes of the tribal communities, he says

title: Overall development of tribal people important for A.P.‚Äôs growth: NTR Collector
content: Focus is on development of infrastructure in tribal areas, and ashram schools are being set up to provide quality education to tribal students, says G. Lakshmish

title: DCC president, LDF candidate allege large-scale voters‚Äô list manipulation in Thrissur LS poll
content: Joseph Tajet accuses BJP‚Äôs Suresh Gopi of orchestrating fraudulent entries; Sunilkumar questions returning officer‚Äôs role and claims deliberate misinformation

title: India welcomes Donald Trump-Vladimir Putin summit in Alaska
content: The meeting holds the promise of bringing to an end the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and opening up the prospects for peace, says Ministry of External Affairs

title: Government has disbursed ‚Çπ1,000 crore to families displaced by Polavaram project: MLA
content: CC roads, drainages and other works worth ‚Çπ85 crore have been taken up in the tribal villages in Eluru district, says Chirri Balaraju

title: Women, kin of deceased donors to get priority in organ transplant, says govt.
content: NOTTO has asked State governments to create permanent posts for transplant coordinators at hospitals that perform organ transplantation and consider training emergency responders and ambulance staff to identify potential deceased donors early

title: YSRCP general secretary alleges assassination plot by TDP leaders
content: Satish Kumar Reddy demands suo motu CBI probe into the alleged threat and accuses TDP leaders of intimidating journalists

title: Long list of boiling issues expected to dominate Monsoon Session of Karnataka legislature
content: The¬†Monsoon¬†Session¬†of the legislature¬†starting on Monday is expected to witness heated exchanges between the Congress and the BJP and the JD(S) on¬†many¬†boiling issues, including the allegation of vote theft, shortage of fertilizers, stampede at M. Chinnaswamy stadium, Special Investigation Team probe into alleged mass burials in Dharmasthala, and¬†‚Äúfailure‚Äù to maintain law and order.

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation‚Äôs climate budget outlines projects to reduce the city‚Äôs carbon footprint
content: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation‚Äôs climate budget focuses on sustainable projects to reduce carbon footprint, setting an example for other local bodies.

title: Schiller vs Miller: Who is the 'Trump whisperer'? The duel shaping tariffs on India, Pak
content: Washington's political landscape is now defined by 'ins' and 'outs,' impacting India's lobbying efforts amid tariff disputes. Despite hiring Jason Miller, India faces challenges as Pakistan's lobbyist, Keith Schiller, gains perceived influence with President Trump. Trump favors direct engagement from foreign leaders, potentially disadvantaging India's more reserved approach to negotiations.

title: Judicial irony: Justice Pardiwala faces heat for harsh HC judge order; past anti-quota row recalled
content: Justice J B Pardiwala, now in the Supreme Court, faced controversy for his remarks as a Gujarat HC judge. In 2015, his anti-reservation comments in a sedition case led to a removal motion, prompting him to expunge the remarks. Recently, his criticism of an Allahabad HC judge was also retracted after intervention, highlighting the complexities of judicial pronouncements.

title: S-400 was a game-changer in Indo-Pak face-off: IAF
content: Air Chief Marshal A P Singh revealed that during Operation Sindoor, India achieved its largest surface-to-air kill by downing a Pakistani aircraft at 300km, crediting the S-400 system. The IAF also confirmed five kills of Pakistani fighters through electronic means. India targeted Pakistani airbases and infrastructure, including hangars and radar sites, causing significant damage and operational disruptions.

title: Retired IG's daughter gets UP cop sacked by dad reinstated
content: In a remarkable legal battle, a lawyer daughter, Anura Singh, successfully fought against her own father, a former Inspector General of Police (IGP), to reinstate a wrongly terminated police head constable. The constable, Tofeek Ahmad, had been accused of molestation and dismissed after a departmental inquiry led by the IGP.

title: J&K: 2 soldiers killed as 9-day Kashmir gunfight grinds on
content: In a fierce gunfight in Kulgam, South Kashmir, Lance Naik Pritpal Singh and Sepoy Harminder Singh of the Sikh Light Infantry, attached to 19 Rashtriya Rifles, were killed during Operation Akhal. The counterterrorism operation, ongoing for nine days, targets Pakistan-trained terrorists in the Akhal Khulsan forest.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: Defence production has soared to an all-time high of 1.5L cr, says Rajnath Singh
content: India's defence production has reached a record high of over Rs 1.5 lakh crore in FY 2024-25, marking an 18% increase from the previous year and a 90% surge since 2019-20. Defence exports have also risen to Rs 23,622 crore.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to youngsters: I believe that best employees are usually...
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, now a billionaire, emphasizes the importance of self-criticism and embracing discomfort for professional growth. He encourages Gen Z to pursue their passions and work with individuals who challenge their abilities. Pichai's management philosophy centers on building mission-oriented teams driven by a shared pursuit of excellence, fostering an environment of trust and commitment.

title: Festival discount: Railways to start round trip offer
content: To ease Diwali-Chhath rush, Indian Railways introduces a pilot 'round trip package' offering a 20% discount on base fares, excluding 'flexi fare' trains like Rajdhani and Vande Bharat. Booking starts August 14 for travel between October 13-26, with return journeys bookable for November 17-December 1.

title: Prepare for SIR of electoral rolls: Assam CEO to district officials
content: Assam is gearing up for a special intensive revision of electoral rolls, directed by the CEO ahead of the Election Commission's schedule. This preparation includes ensuring all election officials are in place and identifying additional booth-level officers. The Chief Minister emphasizes the need to cleanse voter lists, referencing concerns about alleged illegal entries, particularly in border areas.

title: Kapil Sibal: Where is Dhankhar, should we file habeas corpus?
content: Kapil Sibal, former minister, has raised concerns about the sudden disappearance of ex-Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar from public view since his resignation. Sibal expressed that he has been unable to reach Dhankhar and questioned whether a habeas corpus petition should be filed. He also urged the government to disclose Dhankhar's whereabouts and well-being.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at GPT-5 launch: ‚ÄòIndia is our second-largest market‚Ä¶but‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: OpenAI has launched GPT-5, its most advanced AI model, boasting significant improvements in accuracy, speed, and reasoning. CEO Sam Altman highlighted India as a rapidly growing market, potentially surpassing the US. GPT-5 is available in various sizes and tiers, including a free version, with enhanced versions for Team, Enterprise, Edu, and Pro users, marking a step towards Artificial General Intelligence.

title: Taylor Swift chaos: Disguised entrance to Travis Kelce‚Äôs game resurfaces, fans can‚Äôt keep calm
content: An old video of Taylor Swift walking into a Kansas City Chiefs game in September 2023 without security has resurfaced, shocking fans. Disguised in a mask and cap, she walked with Travis Kelce and friends, seizing a rare chance to experience normalcy.

title: Quit if you don't trust EC: BJP to Sonia, Rahul
content: BJP intensified its demand for Rahul Gandhi to substantiate his vote fraud allegations, highlighting his failure to accept the Election Commission's challenge to provide an affidavit. The party suggested Gandhi should resign from Lok Sabha if he lacks confidence in the EC.

title: Air India raises retirement age of pilots from 58 to 65
content: Air India has increased the retirement age for pilots from 58 to 65 years, aligning it with the previous Vistara pilots' retirement age following the merger last November. The retirement age for other employees has also been raised from 58 to 60.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: McDavid and Lauren Kyle steal the show at Draisaitl‚Äôs fairytale wedding
content: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle captivated fans with their charm and elegance at a Provence wedding, overshadowing rumors of another NHL star's nuptials. Lauren's Instagram posts offered a genuine glimpse into the dreamy festivities, showcasing understated style and heartfelt moments. Fans celebrated the couple's natural chemistry and the weekend's blend of style, love, and authentic connection.

title: Evander Kane celebrates Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins‚Äô wedding in style
content: Evander Kane, former Oilers forward, attended Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins' wedding in France, sharing photos on Instagram with a heartfelt message. Accompanied by fianc√©e Mara Teigen, Kane joined other NHL stars like Connor Brown and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins at the lavish event. Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, was a bridesmaid.

title: ICICI Bank hikes min balance for savings a/cs from Rs 10k to Rs 50k
content: ICICI Bank has significantly increased the minimum balance requirement for new savings accounts opened after August 1st, raising it to Rs 50,000 for urban locations. This decision, a five-fold increase, contrasts with the trend of public sector banks waiving such requirements. The move has drawn criticism, with some bankers suggesting it aims to filter out low-value customers.

title: SC sets up panel led by ex-HC judge for Banke Bihari temple
content: The Supreme Court has established an 11-member interim high-powered committee, led by Justice Ashok Kumar, to oversee the Banke Bihari temple's operations and plan its holistic development. The court permitted the Uttar Pradesh government to acquire land for a corridor similar to the Kashi Vishwanath Temple.

title: Kiren Rijiju: New tax bill has essence of original bill
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju addressed concerns regarding the new Income Tax Bill, 2025, assuring that it integrates all amendments proposed by the select committee and accepted by the government. Rijiju emphasized that social media apprehensions are unfounded, as the bill reflects six months of diligent work and incorporates suggested changes, maintaining the original bill's essence.

title: J&K: Congress starts hunger strikes for statehood; allies missing
content: The Congress party in Jammu and Kashmir has initiated a series of hunger strikes to advocate for the restoration of statehood, coinciding with the anniversary of the Quit India Movement. Despite repeated promises from the Modi government and BJP leaders, no concrete steps have been taken, prompting the party to escalate its protests.

title: Selena Gomez on Swift amid reported split with Blake Lively
content: Amidst personal changes, Taylor Swift's friendship with Blake Lively reportedly ended due to legal issues involving Justin Baldoni. Selena Gomez discussed her long-standing bond with Swift, revealing their shared history of dating Jonas Brothers. Swift and Kelce are expected at Gomez's wedding. Swift has been seen reconnecting with Gomez, while distancing herself from Lively and Ryan Reynolds.

title: Pakistan calls IAF chief‚Äôs statement ‚Äòimplausible, ill-timed and politically motivated‚Äô
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif refuted the Indian Air Force chief's claim that India downed multiple Pakistani fighter jets and a large aircraft during Operation Sindoor. Asif dismissed the statement as a ‚Äúdangerous distortion‚Äù intended for domestic political gain.

title: 'Not an era of war': India welcomes US-Russia meet in Alaska
content: India has expressed its support for the upcoming summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025. The meeting is viewed as a promising step towards resolving the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, which began in February 2022.

title: EC delists 334 unrecognised parties over norms breach
content: The Election Commission has delisted 334 registered unrecognised political parties for violating registration guidelines and statutory obligations. This action reduces the total number of such parties to 2,520. These delisted parties will lose income-tax concessions. The decision follows verification inquiries prompted by parties not contesting elections for six years. Parties can appeal the delisting within 30 days.

title: 'Workload management is nonsense': Ex-India cricketer blasts Bumrah
content: Following India's 2-2 Test series draw against England, workload management debates resurface. Sandeep Patil criticises the modern approach, contrasting it with the dedication of past legends like Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, who consistently played without demanding breaks. Patil questions the influence of physios in team selection, emphasising unwavering commitment when representing the nation.

title: 'I Was Shocked' ‚Äì When Samson left speechless by 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: Sanju Samson lauded Vaibhav Suryavanshi's impressive performance for Rajasthan Royals, recalling his own memorable innings as captain against Punjab Kings. However, recent tensions between Samson and the Royals' management have led to a trade or release request. Despite interest from teams like Chennai Super Kings, the Royals must decide whether to retain their captain.

title: BrahMos led offensive, Akashteer guarded skies: Weapons behind Op Sindoor
content: DRDO Chairman Samir V Kamat announced that India's BrahMos missiles and Akashteer air defence system played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor, the retaliatory strike following the Pahalgam terror attack. BrahMos, launched from Sukhoi Mk 1 aircraft, served as the primary offensive weapon, while Akashteer acted as the defensive backbone, integrating sensors to neutralize threats.

title: Rafael Nadal, wife Mery welcome second child - name also revealed
content: Rafael Nadal and his wife, Mery Perello, are now parents of two. They welcomed their second son, Miquel, in Palma. The name is a tribute to Mery's father. Miquel joins his older brother, Rafael Junior. Nadal retired from tennis last year. He is now focusing on family life and business.

title: 'Ghost of Balakot‚Äô laid to rest: Air Force chief on why videos of Operation Sindoor matter - watch
content: Air Force Chief Marshal AP Singh voiced his regret over the absence of video evidence from the 2019 Balakot airstrike, which fueled doubts among opposition leaders regarding its effectiveness. He highlighted that Operation Sindoor addressed this issue by providing recorded footage of airstrikes, effectively dispelling the "ghost of Balakot.

title: Samson recalls Gambhir's warning: 'I‚Äôll remove you from team only if ... '
content: Sanju Samson's career, marked by pivotal support from figures like Suryakumar Yadav and Gautam Gambhir, reached new heights in 2024 with three T20I centuries. Despite his international success, his IPL future with Rajasthan Royals is uncertain. Differences have led Samson to request a trade, but the Royals control his fate.

title: On Sharad Pawar's 160 ‚Äòguaranteed‚Äô seats claim, CM's 'timing' reply
content: Sharad Pawar claimed that before the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections, two individuals promised him 160 seats, a claim that adds weight to Rahul Gandhi's allegations of electoral malpractice. Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of favoring the BJP, citing irregularities in voter turnout and voter list discrepancies in Maharashtra and Karnataka.

title: 'Over 200 arrested': London police crackdown on a pro-Palestinian group
content: London police have arrested approximately 365 individuals after demonstrators openly defied a new law banning public support for 'Palestine Action,' a pro-Palestinian group. The arrests occurred during heightened demonstrations in London, including pro-Palestinian marches and rallies calling for the release of Israeli hostages. Protesters argue the legislation unfairly restricts freedom of expression, challenging the ban in court.

title: Watch: Siraj, Asha Bhosle's granddaughter Zanai celebrate Rakhi together
content: Mohammed Siraj celebrated Raksha Bandhan with Zanai Bhosle, clarifying their brother-sister bond after dating rumors. Siraj's impressive performance on the England tour, where he took 23 wickets, has garnered praise. Wasim Akram lauded Siraj's passion and stamina, noting his evolution into a leading bowler for the Indian team, showcasing remarkable mental strength.

title: Jaz Agassi‚Äôs sweet support for dad Andre Agassi ‚Äî Steffi Graf moment resurfaces
content: Andre Agassi addressed Shore Capital Partner‚Äôs Leadership Academy in New York City on July 14, 2025, emphasizing leadership, mindset, and purpose. Following the fireside chat with Jish Bia, Agassi's daughter, Jaz, expressed her admiration on Instagram. Agassi has previously discussed parenting and his efforts to break negative cycles, highlighting his and Steffi Graf's influence on their children.

title: Navratilova: Chris Evert‚Äôs Catholic upbringing shaped her tennis image
content: Martina Navratilova's comments sparked renewed interest in Chris Evert. Navratilova suggested Evert's strict Catholic upbringing shaped her public image. She contrasted this with her own experiences growing up in Czechoslovakia. Navratilova noted Evert's desire to please her parents influenced her behavior. The remarks added a new layer to their famous rivalry. Their contrasting styles fueled tennis's growth.

title: Earthquake strikes Russia: 6.1 magnitude tremor jolts Kurli Islands
content: A 6.1 magnitude earthquake hit the Kuril Islands on Saturday. The National Center for Seismology reported the event. The quake occurred at a depth of 10 km. Its epicenter was at latitude 49.94¬∞N and longitude 162.70¬∞E. This follows an 8.8 magnitude earthquake off Russia‚Äôs Kamchatka Peninsula. A 5.1 magnitude tremor also occurred near Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky recently.

title: Former Pakistan pacer makes massive Siraj admission: 'He's not just ...'
content: Wasim Akram hails Mohammed Siraj's transformation from a support bowler to India's pace spearhead after his match-winning performance at the Oval. Siraj's nine wickets helped India level the series against England, showcasing his stamina and mental fortitude by bowling over 185 overs.

title: 1 yr of RG Kar incident: 'Bangles broken' - Victim's mother's big charge against WB cops
content: Kolkata witnessed police action against protesters during the ‚ÄòNabanna Abhijan‚Äô march. The rally commemorated the anniversary of a doctor's rape and murder at RG Kar Medical College. The victim's family alleged police obstruction despite court permission. Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari urged BJP workers to join. Security measures included barricades and traffic halts.

title: 'Badi deewar gir gayi hai': Families recall Delhi wall collapse horror; 7 killed
content: In Jaitpur, a wall collapsed near Mohan Baba Mandir due to heavy rain, killing five members of Ranjan's family and trapping eight people in jhuggis. The victims included two children, a woman, and several migrant workers from West Bengal. Police are investigating the structural condition of the wall and potential negligence, while one survivor receives treatment.

title: Data network outage at Mumbai airport: Flight operations hit; Air India issues advisory
content: Air India reported that a data network outage at Mumbai Airport disrupted check-in systems, causing flight delays, including its own. While the issue has been resolved, Air India cautioned that some flights might still experience delays as operations gradually return to normal.

title: Hezbollah military facility explosion: 5 soldiers killed while clearing munitions
content: Five Lebanese soldiers tragically died in an explosion at a Hezbollah military facility near Majdal Zoun, Tyre district, while clearing munitions left over from the recent conflict with Israel. The facility was being dismantled by the Lebanese army under a November truce agreement.

title: Why new RBs coach Tashard Choice fits in Detroit
content: quarterback Tashard Choice is on the practice field in his first season on the Lions' coaching staff . "it means a lot. We've been close since I was 16 or 17 now," Gibbs says . he says he's a 'familiar face' and 'we just ended up together' "it's really great having a familiar face," he adds .

title: NBA's new financial rules threaten dynasties: 'Harder choices' for top teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .

title: Tar Heels land Harpring, No. 4 in ESPNW 100
content: the no. 4 player in the 2026 ESPNW 100 class has committed to North Carolina . the 5-foot-10 guard had official visits to north Carolina, UCLA , Iowa and Vanderbilt . she had offers from nearly every major program including UConn , South Carolina , Duke , Texas and Tennessee .

title: üèà Fantasy Draft Guide: Rankings, mock, analysis

title: Jackson, No. 8 in ESPNW 100, commits to Terps
content: Jordyn Jackson is the no. 8 player in the 2026 ESPNW 100 class . she chose Maryland over finalists TCU , Alabama , Miami , South Carolina and Ohio State . Jackson recently wrapped up her club career on the Nike EYBL circuit with team Durant .

title: 'Amazing': Pawol 1st woman to umpire MLB game

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Giants rookie QB Jaxson Dart decisive, efficient in debut
